program description: Program Description Program OverviewGeorge Brown College’s English as a Second Language (ESL) (Part-Time) Certificate is an accelerated hybrid program to help you develop your English language skills for personal, professional and academic purposes. We offer eight levels of instruction that range from low beginner to advanced and a variety of elective courses to meet your individual learning needs. Each level runs for six weeks and combines a variety of activities designed to strengthen reading, writing, listening, and speaking skills.Full DescriptionIMPORTANT NOTE: This program is currently being delivered in a hybrid format that includes both in-person and online instruction. George Brown College’s English as a Second Language (ESL) (Part-Time) certificate is a non-credit program that will help you develop the English language skills you need to succeed in a fast-paced transformational global environment.With eight levels of instruction that range from low beginner to advanced, and a variety of elective courses to suit your personal, professional, and academic learning needs, you will build confidence in your skills as you progress through the program.Courses you complete in this ESL program are recognized by our full-time English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program. The more ESL courses you complete, the fewer EAP courses you will be required to take to complete that certificate. Click on the ‘Career & Postgraduate Study Opportunities’ tab located on the left side of this page for more details.PLEASE NOTE: These ESL courses do not count as credit toward other George Brown admission requirements: Admission RequirementsIf you are new to the program and it is your first time applying, you must take the level placement test. You will start the program from the level based on the placement test results.Alternatively, if you have completed an ESL course at George Brown College within the last six months, you can apply to start at the next level without having to complete a placement test.Special RequirementsYou must achieve a grade of B (73%) or better to successfully complete each course.There are two requirements for completing the certificate:Complete at least five (5) ESL courses at GBC;Complete ESL 9068 (ESL IIIB ADVANCED).Example:If you take the level placement test and begin with ESL 9000 (ESL IA LOW BEGINNER), you will need to complete all 8 compulsory courses (Therefore, completed at least 5 ESL courses and completed ESL 9068 (ESL IIIB ADVANCED) to achieve the certificate.If you take the level placement test and begin with ESL 9066 (ESL IIC HIGH INTERMEDIATE), you will need to complete ESL 9066 (ESL IIC HIGH INTERMEDIATE), ESL 9067 (IIIA LOW ADVANCED) and ESL 9068 (ESL IIIB ADVANCED) plus 2 elective courses (Therefore, completed at least 5 ESL courses and completed ESL 9068 (ESL IIIB ADVANCED)) to achieve the certificate. Placement TestOnce you have registered, please visit Continuing Education (part–time) ESL Program Placement Test Registration to sign up for the level placement test.How to ApplyDOMESTIC AND INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS:To apply for the program, please visit the Courses section and register directly in your respective course(s) by following the instructions provided.INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS OF R901 PROGRAM:You DO NOT need to apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
